result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larkricia E. McDaniel

records.addlTxt: Competency hearing on January 13, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records.
Order of Commitment for Treatment. (Incompetency)

Defendant is choosing not to participate in today's hearing.   Testimony presented.   
Court finds the defendant is incompetent to assist in her own defense but is likely to become competent with treatment.   Court orders defendant committed to inpatient restoration treatment at Mendota.   Competency hearing is reset to 10-20-22 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
Review hearing on October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Philip Hoff, through Public Defender.
Competency hearing on July 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Report of Kristin Johnson, Psy.D.
Competency hearing on July 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Email correspondence.

Defendant not appearing.   
Dr. Speech was unable to complete an examination of the defendant and is requesting for an order for an inpatient examination.   The parties are in agreement with this recommendation.   Court orders an inpatient examination to be completed.   Status conference s set for 06-10-22 at 12:00 noon.   
Minutes.
Status conference on June 10, 2022 at 12:00 pm.
Competency hearing on July 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:45 PM Defendant Larkricia E. McDaniel in custody, but not in court.  Attorney Dominique McQueen in court for Larkricia E. McDaniel.  Attorney DeFranca Barros appears in person for Attorney Jordan W. Feest for State of Wisconsin.  State takes notice that McDaniel refused to appear for this hearing today.  Court will have this matter set as a scheduling/status with Defendant's other case, 19CF543, on June 1, 2022 at 1:15 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on June 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:40 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Larkricia E. McDaniel appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dominique McQueen appeared by video for Larkricia E. McDaniel. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:31 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Larkricia E. McDaniel not in court. Defendant currently in Manitowoc County Jail and refuses to appear.   Attorney Dominique McQueen appeared by video for Larkricia E. McDaniel.  Competency has been raised in another case.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:23 PM - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Larkricia E. McDaniel not in court. She refused to make an appearance from the Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Dominique McQueen appeared by video for Larkricia E. McDaniel.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Dominique McQueen through Public Defender

Defendant in jail, refuses to come to initial appearance.   Initial appearance is reset to 05-02-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, on 03-28-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping and resist officer.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-04-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $200.00 cash bond with the conditions that she report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, within 24 hours of release and defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, within 24 hours of release.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.

Defendant Larkricia E. McDaniel appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Philip L Hoff appeared by video for Larkricia E. McDaniel.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
The matter was set for a competency hearing today.  However, after briefly staying in meeting, the defendant exited the room she was appearing from and was no longer present for the hearing.  
Attorney Hoff states that this would need to be a contested hearing at this point. 
Contested competency hearing set for 07-09-2022 at 09:00am.
